statements: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT name, email FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 2;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE name LIKE '%John%';
SELECT customer_id, preferences FROM customers WHERE buying_pattern = 'high';
SELECT name, email, buying_pattern FROM customers ORDER BY buying_pattern DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT name, email FROM customers WHERE customer_id IN (1, 3, 5);
SELECT preferences FROM customers WHERE name LIKE 'S%' ORDER BY customer_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE buying_pattern = 'High' AND email LIKE '%@gmail.com';
SELECT name, preferences FROM customers WHERE buying_pattern = 'Low' ORDER BY name ASC LIMIT 3;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, customer_id FROM customers ORDER BY customer_name DESC;
SELECT customer_name FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT customer_name, preferences FROM customers ORDER BY customer_id DESC;
SELECT category_name, customer_count FROM categories WHERE customer_count > 100;
SELECT customer_name, preferences FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 100;
SELECT customer_name, preferences FROM customers WHERE customer_id > 50 ORDER BY customer_id DESC;
SELECT customer_name, preferences FROM customers WHERE customer_id < 200 AND customer_name ILIKE 'A%' ORDER BY customer_name;
SELECT category_name, customer_count FROM categories WHERE customer_count > 100 ORDER BY category_name;
SELECT category_name, customer_count FROM categories WHERE category_name ILIKE 'T%' AND customer_count < 50 ORDER BY customer_count DESC;
SELECT name, email FROM customers;
SELECT * FROM buying_patterns WHERE purchase_frequency > 5;
SELECT name, preference_category FROM customers ORDER BY preference_category DESC;
SELECT * FROM category_preferences WHERE preference_id BETWEEN 100 AND 200;
SELECT name, buying_pattern FROM customers WHERE buying_pattern = 'Impulsive' ORDER BY id ASC;
SELECT name, email FROM customers WHERE preference_category = 'Clothing' ORDER BY name ASC;
SELECT id, email, preference_category FROM customers WHERE buying_pattern = 'Frequent' ORDER BY email DESC;
SELECT id, name, preference_category FROM customers WHERE buying_pattern = 'Occasional' AND preference_category = 'Electronics';
SELECT * FROM buying_patterns WHERE purchase_frequency > 5 ORDER BY pattern_name ASC;

SELECT c.id, c.name, p.preference_name, b.pattern_name FROM customers c JOIN category_preferences p ON c.preference_category = p.preference_name JOIN buying_patterns b ON c.buying_pattern = b.pattern_name;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, customer_email FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT preference_name, preference_category FROM preferences ORDER BY preference_name DESC;
SELECT customer_name, customer_address FROM customers WHERE customer_address IS NOT NULL;
SELECT category_id, category_name FROM categories WHERE category_id = 3;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM customers WHERE customer_email LIKE '%gmail.com';
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, customer_email, customer_phone FROM customers ORDER BY customer_name ASC;
SELECT c.customer_id, p.preference_name FROM customers c JOIN preferences p ON c.customer_id = p.customer_id WHERE p.preference_category = 'Food';
SELECT c.customer_id, c.customer_name, p.purchase_date, p.total_amount FROM customers c JOIN purchases p ON c.customer_id = p.customer_id WHERE p.total_amount > 1000 ORDER BY p.total_amount DESC;
SELECT * FROM Customers;
SELECT customer_name, city, email FROM Customers ORDER BY city ASC;
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(customer_id) AS total_purchases FROM Purchases GROUP BY customer_id;
SELECT category_id, category_name FROM Categories WHERE category_id > 3;
SELECT purchase_id, total_amount, purchase_date FROM Purchases ORDER BY total_amount DESC;
SELECT * FROM Customers WHERE city = 'New York';
SELECT customer_name, email FROM Customers WHERE preferences->>'favourite_category' = 'Electronics';
SELECT c.customer_name, p.total_amount FROM Customers c JOIN Purchases p ON c.customer_id = p.customer_id WHERE p.total_amount > 1000;
SELECT category_name, COUNT(*) AS total_purchases FROM Categories JOIN Products ON Categories.category_id = Products.category_id GROUP BY category_name;
SELECT * FROM PurchaseDetails ORDER BY price DESC, quantity ASC LIMIT 5;
